episodeTitle: A Clear-Clear History? Sanji's Stolen Dream
episodeTitleJapanese: Suke Suke no Innen? Ubawareta Sanji no Yume
episodeTitleRomanized: Suke Suke no Innen? Ubawareta Sanji no Yume
description: Sanji battles Absalom in a fury after revealing his childhood dream of obtaining the Clear-Clear Fruit. Meanwhile, Luffy struggles against Gecko Moria's shadow duplicate Doppelman and discovers a way to strike the Warlord directly. Usopp chases after Perona, who reveals herself as the Ghost Princess.

events.title: Sanji's Childhood Dream Revealed
events.description: Sanji reveals that as a child, he read the Devil Fruit Encyclopedia and desired only one fruit - the Suke Suke no Mi (Clear-Clear Fruit). He declares that Absalom has stolen his dream by eating the fruit before he could find it.
events.significance: Provides character insight into Sanji's perverted nature and shows he's had knowledge of Devil Fruits since childhood. This is the first time Sanji reveals he actually wanted a Devil Fruit power, despite the curse it brings.

quotes.text: I read about it in the Devil Fruit Encyclopedia... If I ever found that fruit, I would accept its curse and eat it myself. But if anyone else found it, it would kill my dream!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji explaining his childhood desire for the Clear-Clear Fruit

events.title: Sanji's Enraged Assault on Absalom
events.description: Fueled by rage over his stolen dream, Sanji unleashes a devastating barrage of kicks on Absalom. Despite being previously injured, Sanji's fury gives him overwhelming strength as he beats Absalom mercilessly.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's fighting prowess when motivated by strong emotions. Shows that his perverted nature, while comedic, is a genuine character trait tied to his desires.

quotes.text: You ate the fruit and robbed me of my dream of seeing naked women!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji confronting Absalom during their battle

events.title: Absalom's Invisibility Mechanics Explained
events.description: Sanji reveals his understanding of how Absalom's Clear-Clear Fruit works, explaining that Absalom can make objects and people invisible by touching them, not just himself.
events.significance: Provides tactical information about the Suke Suke no Mi's abilities and shows Sanji's strategic mind in analyzing Devil Fruit powers.

events.title: Luffy vs Doppelman
events.description: Luffy continues his struggle against Gecko Moria's shadow duplicate, Doppelman. The shadow transforms into Brick Bats (bat-shaped shadow creatures) that swarm and peck at Luffy, making it difficult for him to counter-attack.
events.significance: Shows the versatility of Moria's Kage Kage no Mi powers and Luffy's difficulty in dealing with an intangible opponent.

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Stamp Against Moria
events.description: Luffy discovers a way to bypass Doppelman by jumping off the ledge and using his rubber body to swing back up with Gomu Gomu no Stamp, successfully kicking Gecko Moria through the floor. This is the first solid hit Luffy lands on the Warlord.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's creativity in combat and his ability to adapt to difficult opponents. Shows that Moria himself is vulnerable even if his shadow isn't.

quotes.text: You said I can't touch you, right? Then take this! Gomu Gomu no... Stamp!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy taunting Moria after landing a successful hit

events.title: Usopp Defeats Kumashi
events.description: Usopp uses his Flame Star attack to set the zombie bear Kumashi on fire, then creates an oil trail to intensify the flames. Despite the damage, Kumashi continues pursuing Usopp until being crushed by debris.
events.significance: Shows Usopp's resourcefulness in combat and his ability to handle zombie enemies effectively.

events.title: Perona Reveals Herself as the Ghost Princess
events.description: Usopp catches up to Perona, who is floating outside a window in her astral projection form. She dramatically introduces herself as the Ghost Princess and threatens to eliminate all the Straw Hat Pirates.
events.significance: Sets up the upcoming confrontation between Usopp and Perona, which becomes one of the most memorable battles in the Thriller Bark arc due to their Devil Fruit abilities' interaction.

quotes.text: I am the Ghost Princess! Once you're out of the picture, the rest of your crew will be next!
quotes.speaker: Perona
quotes.context: Perona introducing herself to Usopp while in astral form

events.title: Perona's Astral Projection Ability
events.description: Perona demonstrates her ability to leave her physical body and project her consciousness as a ghost form using the powers of the Horo Horo no Mi. In this form, she can float and is seemingly intangible.
events.significance: Introduces a key aspect of Perona's Devil Fruit abilities that will be crucial in her upcoming battle with Usopp.

events.title: Sanji's Flames of Rage
events.description: The episode ends with Sanji continuing his assault on Absalom, described as showing 'flames of rage' while Nami remains unconscious nearby, emphasizing Sanji's protective nature toward women.
events.significance: Reinforces Sanji's character trait of being extremely protective of women, which motivates much of his fighting spirit.

themes.description: The episode explores Sanji's childhood dream of obtaining the Clear-Clear Fruit, showing how even minor character aspirations can fuel intense emotions and actions.
themes.symbolism: Sanji's 'stolen dream' represents how opportunities lost to others can create rivalry and conflict.

themes.description: Both Luffy and Usopp demonstrate creative problem-solving in their respective battles, using unconventional tactics to overcome difficult opponents.
themes.symbolism: The various battle strategies represent the Straw Hats' adaptability and intelligence in combat.

themes.description: Sanji's rage is amplified by Absalom's actions toward Nami, emphasizing his protective nature toward women.
themes.symbolism: Sanji's 'flames of rage' symbolize his unwavering dedication to protecting women.

mangaDifferences.difference: The Japanese TV broadcast censored Absalom's stabbing of Sanji, replacing it with a kick. The original stabbing scene was restored in the DVD release.

The censorship was implemented due to the recent Akihabara massacre in June 2008, where a man stabbed multiple people. The anime altered scenes showing Absalom stabbing Sanji to be more sensitive to the tragedy.

trivia.fact: This episode was censored in its initial Japanese broadcast due to its proximity to the Akihabara massacre on June 8, 2008, just two weeks before the episode aired. The stabbing scenes were altered to kicks in the TV version.
The Japanese DVD release and international versions contain the uncensored version with the original stabbing scenes intact, though the English dub uses the altered sound effects from the TV version.
This is the first episode to explicitly reveal that Sanji had studied the Devil Fruit Encyclopedia as a child and had knowledge of specific Devil Fruits before meeting Luffy.

Jungle P, the opening song for this episode, was the first One Piece opening to feature the Thousand Sunny ship and Franky as an official crew member, and also showed Brook before he officially joined.
Episode 359 covers manga chapters 463-464, maintaining a pace of approximately 2 chapters per episode during the Thriller Bark arc.
